column1: Little Goat Diner////We stopped by here after being discouraged by a 2.5-hour wait from another restaurant on this increasingly popular street.  After hearing so much about it
column2: and the plethora of reviews on Yelp
column3: we were surprised to be seated immediately.  Having done no research except knowing about Stephanie Izard
column4: we were delightfully surprised by the breakfast-all-day mixed with lots of Asian influences.  Faced with so many equally delicious sounding choices
column5: we ultimately settled on the goat burger with kimchi and fried egg
column8: and a brandade with pork belly.
